pull.title: Add sane fallback for fee estimation
pull.body:
Make fee estimation logic respect GetRequiredFee at all times.
In addition add new commandline option "-fallbackfee" to use when fee estimation does not have sufficient data.

events.message: Always respect GetRequiredFee for wallet txs

Add sane fallback for fee estimation

Add new commandline option "-fallbackfee" to use when fee estimation does not have sufficient data.

events.body:
Addressed @MarcoFalke's comments.
Although left fee = 20k satoshis until the bikeshedding is finished.  I don't care want goes there, but I propose using the result of estimatefee(4) with a significantly longer time decay over the last few months.  I'll post the result of that once calculated.

This is meant for 0.12 backport

@MarcoFalke ugh.. thanks.  more than just that one fail.  These are probably things that should be fixed b/c the travis tests that fail are implicitly depending on estimatefee returning minrelaytxfee, which isn't a good assumption.  I'm working on it

events.message: SQUASHME: Fix rpc tests that assumed fallback to minRelayTxFee

events.body: Reminder: @wumpus on github is not a bitcoin person.

Apologies.

@laanwj I think we could use this in 0.12

Concept ACK.

One nit: this adds yet another `-XXXfee` parameter.
Although it makes sense, for the wallet we already have `-mintxfee`, `-paytxfee`, `-maxtxfee` this wild growth of options does get a bit confusing for users, I think.
But I don't know a better solution either.

issue.title: [0.12] Update release-notes.md
issue.body:
- Transaction memory pool limiting
- Priority transactions
- Wallet transaction fees

events.body: @laanwj it's also not clear whether those parameters are referring to the wallet or to relay policy (until you read the documentation in-depth, anyway).

issue.title: Always respect GetRequiredFee for wallet txs
issue.body:
Split off of #7296 in case we don't want a new arg.

Just to assert that travis does not fail.

events.body: Concept ACK will test later today.

issue.title: Add fundrawtransaction
issue.body:
Adds fundrawtransaction RPC call. Includes the following from Bitcoin Core:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6088 - fundrawtransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6417 - [QA] fix possible reorg issue in (fund)rawtransaction(s).py RPC test
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6444 - Exempt unspendable transaction outputs from dust checks
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6415 - Implement watchonly support in fundrawtransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6828 - [rpc-tests] fundrawtransaction: Update fee after minRelayTxFee increase
commit bebe58 from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7296
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7506 - Use CCoinControl selection in CWallet::FundTransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7518 - Add multiple options to fundrawtransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7967 - [RPC] add feerate option to fundrawtransaction

Includes the updates up until their test framework supported python3. There are more changes that should be ported over after this.

issue.title: [Wallet][RPC] FundTransaction - fundrawtransaction
issue.body:
based on top of
- [x] #1662 

This introduces a new wallet function, `CWallet::FundTransaction()` (and exposes it via RPC with `fundrawtransaction`), to fill a tx containing only vouts (or not enough vins to cover the vouts) with unspent coins from the wallet.

`fundrawtransaction` will not modify existing inputs, and will add one change output (if needed) to the outputs. It will not sign the inputs (so can include also watch-only or multi-sig inputs, if enabled).

backported from:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6088
- bitcoin/bitcoin#17219 [`*`]
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6417
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6444
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6415
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6828 
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7296 (only bebe58b748532157958f9055e4517e280684006c)
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7506
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7518
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7967

adapting the tests for the (more recent) framework.

[`*`] Note: this has been included to be able to call `fundrawtransaction` without the need for an unencrypted wallet (for the change address key)

comments.body:
This is important on it's own. Could you split this diff (line 2236-2237) into a separate commit?

Edit: See  995b9f3
I'd say `11000` is enough, we can determine a "better" `DEFAULT_` for 0.13
